results.title: Just another lonely unicycle robot
results.brief_description: Drawing inspiration from Pixar’s Luxo the lamp, this short student digital animation is about a young unicycle robot, who just wants to be friends.

results.title: Garden of Eden
results.brief_description: Overall winner of the 2002 ACMI Infogrames Diegesis, Garden of Eden was described by the judges as ‘aesthetically mature’ and ‘conceptually rich, reminiscent of the brothers Quay’. The filmmaker was attempting to explore the theme of ‘nature versus religion’ and this rather dark vision features mesmorising characters that occupy a surreal landscape with a haunting original soundtrack of strings.

results.title: Found
results.brief_description: This film effectively communicates a story as well as the emotions behind it with little reliance on dialogue. Annabelle explains the film ‘ A girl longs for connection with her absent father. A chance encounter brings new hope’ This film won the ACMI award for original sound in diegesis 2002.

results.title: Corps de deux
results.brief_description: A stylish looking short filmed without dialogue in the heart of Melbourne’s CBD. Images of the ‘boys’ on the town are inter-cut with more serious scenes of martial arts that have a dance-like quality. The student filmmaker describes it as ‘a conceptual piece that explores opposing aspects of the male psyche’

results.title: Aquatica
results.brief_description: ‘George Rolfe’s ‘Aquatica’ conveys the epic grandeur that the 3D medium is capable of. His vision of vast futuristic cities is simply not possible in film ‘ it can only be done in 3D animation. George’s piece has no narrative, but is connected by the theme of water ‘ life above it, and life below it. He has an amazing eye for cinematography, and with relatively simple models has effectively conveyed the scope of massive landscapes and titanic struggles. Key to the piece are the camera movements, and the star of the show is the water, which is exceptional ‘ sparkling, reflective, and in constant motion. It’s a work of sophistication and maturity.Judges comment diegesis 2002

He has an amazing eye for cinematography, and with relatively simple models has effectively conveyed the scope of massive landscapes and titanic struggles. It’s a work of sophistication and maturity.Judges comment diegesis 2002

It’s a work of sophistication and maturity.Judges comment diegesis 2002
